image.altText: Tasmania Fire Service personnel near fire trucks.

props.synopsis: A fight over the wages of police, firefighters, paramedics and others is brewing as the first test for the next Tasmanian government, once that is finalised.

title.children: Tasmanian public sector unions threaten broad industrial action in first test for government

image.altText: Sue Neill-Fraser, photo from Facebook page.

props.synopsis: Convicted murderer Susan Neill-Fraser was released on parole in 2022 under strict conditions. Her legal team is challenging a "new" condition, further preventing her talking about her case.

title.children: Convicted killer Susan Neill-Fraser challenging new 'restrictive' parole condition

image.altText: Tasmanian Greens Member Rosalie Woodruff 2025-05-27 10:05:00

props.synopsis: Like in the AFL, Tasmanian politics is in its own trade week — and at the moment, the protracted negotiations are between Labor and the Greens.

title.children: Labor have so far failed to sway the Greens, and it's blown up on them

image.altText: a young man with long hair in a washed out photo

props.synopsis: In January, the names of more than 120 adults and children whose body parts may have been retained by a Tasmanian pathology museum without consent were published by the coroner's office - John Santi's brother Tony was one on them.

title.children: A museum held a part of John's late brother without him knowing, now he's laying it to rest

image.altText: An image of a potato cut in half with rust coloured arcs inside on its flesh.

props.synopsis: Potato mop-top virus, which does not harm humans, has been found in multiple potatoes on a Tasmanian farm — a first for Australia.

title.children: Virus 'previously exotic to Australia' found in Tasmanian potatoes

image.altText: Small blocks of cheese labelled Pyengana Dairy sit on a supermarket sheft.

props.synopsis: After selling Betta Milk, Meander Valley Dairy and Shima Wasabi, another Tasmanian brand is being sold off by TasFoods.

title.children: Pyengana Dairy the latest on the TasFoods chopping block

image.altText: Woman poses for photo, leaning against a black fence at a racecourse

props.synopsis: The announcement of funding being ended for Tasmania's greyhound racing industry has left the people who work in it "filthy, angry", a trainer says — with special mention made of the Liberal state premier.

title.children: Greyhound industry 'filthy and angry' over Tasmanian ban

image.altText: a large, red and white passenger ferry in dock

props.synopsis: The 212-metre-long ship has arrived in Australian waters after a six-week voyage from Europe — but it will still be more than a week before it is expected to reach Hobart.

title.children: Spirit of Tasmania IV arrives in Australia after voyage from Scotland

image.altText: Man smiles for photo in a church.

props.synopsis: Tasmania has a new archbishop, among the first appointments made by Pope Leo — and his style is said to be quite different to his predecessor.

title.children: New Catholic Archbishop expected to bring a shift in style from predecessor

image.altText: A man holds a large wooden implement in front of another man who is smiling

props.synopsis: Senior ministers from both countries journeyed to the top of Mount Yasur to initial the Nakamal Agreement, but many details linked to the deal remain under wraps.

title.children: Australia and Vanuatu agree to pact worth $500m atop a volcano

image.altText: A man stands in front of a TV screen projecting a deepfake version of himself at a desk.

props.synopsis: The AI revolution is well underway in Australia’s schools but what does that mean for the way students learn and think?

title.children: This school principal turned himself into a deepfake AI. What's next?

image.altText: A composite image showing three people featured against a computer-generated backdrop

props.synopsis: The Productivity Commission's interim report on AI has triggered a fierce backlash from the literary community.

title.children: Authors warn AI copyright exception a 'free pass' for Big Tech to steal work

image.altText: Western United player Riku Danzaki controls the ball while a teammate looks on.

props.synopsis: Former A-League player Riku Danzaki will avoid jail after pleading guilty to deliberately receiving yellow cards in an illegal betting scheme.

title.children: Former A-League player avoids jail after admitting role in betting scheme

image.altText: A white man, wearing white button up shirt, gray tie, brown hair in focus. Woman in foreground, man in background out of focus

props.synopsis: The injured pilot of the crashed chopper at the centre of Matt Wright's trial has told jurors the celebrity crocodile wrangler visited him in hospital, where he deleted notes and texts from the man's phone.

title.children: 'Anti-vaxxer', hospital manipulation claims aired in Matt Wright trial

image.altText: US President Donald Trump speaks to President Vladimir Putin, who is smiling.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin will sit down this weekend at an Alaskan air base for talks on ending the war in Ukraine.

title.children: Trump and Putin will meet this weekend in Alaska — here's what we know

image.altText: Julie Bishop stands in a conference room smiling

props.synopsis: ACT independent Senator David Pocock says he is concerned the issues facing the Australian National University are affecting its staff and students and calls for more transparency.

title.children: Bishop should stand aside from ANU role amid bullying claim, senator says

image.altText: A large grey navy ship sails through open water against a grey-blue sky

props.synopsis: The US Navy's operation was the first in the South China Sea's Scarborough Shoal region in at least six years.

title.children: China and US clash over South China Sea operation near disputed shoal

image.altText: CBA logo on black wall next to yellow tiled wall

props.synopsis: Australia's biggest company CBA has posted a $10.13 billion net profit but billions were wiped off the bank's share price, as analysts say the stock was "priced for perfection".

title.children: Commonwealth Bank profit tops $10 billion but not enough to justify 'lofty valuation'

image.altText: A photo of a young girl with blonde hair and blue eyes, smiling.

props.synopsis: Police are urgently appealing for the public's assistance to locate the missing toddler from Molong in the state's Central West.

title.children: 1yo girl missing in NSW Central West as police appeal for public's help

image.altText: Dead sea life under the water, grey clouds above the water

props.synopsis: An Indigenous elder calls on the government to take more action on SA's toxic algal bloom as Environment Minister Murray Watt and Opposition Leader Sussan Ley both visit the state.

title.children: SA's algal bloom devastation like watching 'Uluru being destroyed'

image.altText: A woman with a pink jacket stands and speaks at a press conference

props.synopsis: The Coalition says Anthony Albanese has been "shamed" for his decision to recognise a Palestinian state after the move received praise by terror group Hamas, whose October 7 attack on Israel triggered the conflict in Gaza.

title.children: Coalition accuses Labor of emboldening Hamas, after terror group praises move to recognise

image.altText: Woman in AFP uniform around plants

props.synopsis: The Australian Federal Police said officers responded to a request for assistance from an airline at Sudney Airport after the man was "acting suspiciously" this morning.

title.children: Man charged after police gun fired at Sydney Airport during arrest

image.altText: A woman wearing a dress leans against a man wearing a brown military uniform

props.synopsis: Northern NSW resident Cherry Watts was washing her newborn sister's nappies when her city was destroyed by an atomic bomb at the end of World War II.

title.children: Hiroshima atomic bomb survivor is country town's 'national treasure'

image.altText: A children's toy bear laying sideways on a floor.

props.synopsis: A string of regulatory failings saw a Victorian childcare worker retain a legal clearance to work with children — despite being blacklisted from the industry after an investigation found he was grooming toddlers.

title.children: Childcare worker who 'groomed toddlers' to lose Working with Children Check

image.altText: Mark Latham in a black coat and orange time walking

props.synopsis: In one recent social media post, Mark Latham suggested that the NCAT case involved an "absurd proposition" that Alex Greenwich should "never be publicly criticised".

title.children: Latham tells tribunal MPs 'have disagreements all the time'

image.altText: James Crisp x

props.synopsis: A father and son were accused of preying on victims at a Catholic boarding school but only one was charged.  Now they are both behind bars.

title.children: Father and son jailed decades after role in alleged school paedophile ring

image.altText: A sketch of a man with dark hair and a dark beard in a dark t-shirt.

props.synopsis: The man accused of murdering Athena Georgopoulos and her partner Andrew Gunn at a unit in Mount Waverley on Monday night faces court for the first time.

title.children: Man accused of murdering pregnant woman and partner faces Melbourne court

image.altText: An image of a man with glasses and grey hair inset against an emergency department sign and a hospital building.

props.synopsis: A coroner rules a dementia patient who disappeared from a regional Queensland hospital in 2023, never to be seen again, died from dehydration. It prompted security changes, but did not stop similar incidents.

title.children: Dementia patient walks out of hospital never to be seen again

image.altText: Bottles of Pepsi are pictured at a grocery store in California.

props.synopsis: A bid by the Australian Tax Office to impose taxes on American soft drink giant PepsiCo has failed comprehensively, with the High Court throwing out the case.

title.children: High Court throws out ATO's case against soft drink giant PepsiCo

image.altText: Maroubra Housing

props.synopsis: Australia is now a "home owner's welfare state", leading economists argue, and if the tax treatment of housing were reformed, the nation as a whole would benefit.

title.children: Australia is a 'home owners' welfare state'. Taxing the family home may be the answer

image.altText: Signage at a Telstra store in Sydney.

props.synopsis: About 100,000 Telstra customers in southern NSW were without internet and phone coverage for more than an hour after an incident at the telco's North Nowra exchange site.

title.children: 100,000 Telstra customers back online after widespread outage in NSW

image.altText: An illustration of two small whales, one with its mouth open showing sharp teeth, about to eat fish.

props.synopsis: A 25-million-year-old skull has led researchers to discover a new species of tiny whale, filling an evolutionary gap for humpback and blue whales.

title.children: Big-eyed ancient whale with razor-sharp teeth discovered via fossil

image.altText: A dark coloured pig in a paddock.

props.synopsis: A pig control program in a known West Australian problem area has killed 12,000 pigs in six months, leaving farmers and experts stunned.

title.children: Record pig kill shocks farmers struggling with damage from pest

image.altText: A very large dead great white shark found on a beach in Louth Bay.

props.synopsis: The discovery of a 5-metre great white shark missing its jaws is labelled "bizarre and worrying" by an illegal animal trade expert.

title.children: Great white shark found with missing jaws sparks illegal trade concerns
